meanings.definition: To shout loudly in anger or excitement.
meanings.sent1: She yelled at the top of her lungs when she saw the spider.
meanings.sent2: The coach yelled instructions to the players during the game.
meanings.sent3: The parrot yelled back at the noisy children in the park.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm yelled its fury across the dark sky.
meanings.sent5: His words echoed in the empty room as he yelled for help.

meanings.sent1: Yesterday, he yelled for his lost dog until he found it.
meanings.sent2: She yelled in surprise when the balloons popped.
meanings.sent3: The cat yelled at the closed door, demanding to be let in.
meanings.sent4: The old house yelled its history through the creaking floorboards.
meanings.sent5: The wind yelled through the trees, creating a haunting melody.
